Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Now them first two, you gonna get your money's worth.  This one here's more expensive, but that's 'cause there ain't a nigger flaw in one of 'em. They hard as steel and emerald green as emerald green fuckin' comes. Lookit that.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: That's nice.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: That's the real McCoy. That's what that is.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Tell you what... Bag 'em all. The market's got a hard-on for this shit.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I hear that.  Jake, get on it.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: ...And today, thirty-one year old Gary Plauche pleaded innocent by reason of insanity, to charges of second-degree murder in the slaying of accused sex offender, Jeffrey Doucett.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: What do you got there? Diamonds?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: That's thirty grand. Out the door. You interested?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Ain't got the scratch right now. But I am interested.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: From East Baton Rouge Sheriff's office...

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: Doucett was being extradited to Baton Rouge.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: The victim's father, Gary Plauche, stood waiting at the terminal. As Doucett walked by, Plauche turned, raised a handgun...and fired.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Here you go. Fifteen three-karat blues. Wholesale. Twenty large.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: Lieutenant Carter was unavailable for comment.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Motherfucker, he's a cop.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Fuck! Go! Go!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Think I broke a knuckle on that guy's tooth.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: He only had one tooth.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Well I got it, didn't I?

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Another round, Sherry.

Speaker: sherry
Dialogue: Comin' up.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Bud, we all supposed to be celebratin'. 'Been workin' this case for months. And you ain't said shit.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: They had a lot of weight. Too much.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: It's a ring. Organized burglary.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: You saw them guys. You think that half ass crew was organized?

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: They shit their pants in unison.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What are you gettin' after, Bud?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: You think it was someone else's score.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I think its a part of somethin' bigger.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Tomorrow morning we put our friends under the lamp. If they know this "someone else", we'll know him too.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I told you... I keep tellin' you... I don't know nothin'. That's it.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: That's not it. We've been here all morning. We'll stay here all night.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: The stones you were fencin' belonged to an Amsec wall safe in "Kay's Jewelers". The rest from a vault in Bocage. Both owners can verify their belongings, and have.  Who you fencin' for?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Man, I ain't sayin' fuckin' shit.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Then your name's on a dozen other jobs, just like it.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: That's bullshit.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: No, that's a promise.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We got a series of burglaries in the area. All over the last six months. All still open. You don't talk, it's on you.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Well I ain't got nothin' to do with that.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Any idea who does?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: No! Okay? Fuck no.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: ...Answer the question.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: MAN FUCK THIS! AND FUCK YOU! Y'ALL CREW'S JUST FAGGOTS IN MATCHING JACKETS!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Try this. I know you're too fuckin' dumb to be any more than a courier. I know you're coverin' for someone else. NOW TELL ME WHO THAT SOMEONE IS!

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I ain't a rat!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: YOU AIN'T A RAT?!

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Easy, Bud. Go easy.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: STOP THIS SHIT! STOP HIM!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: LOCK THE DOOR!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'll teach you what commitment is... I'll throw you in an eight by nine and have you fucked in the ass by every inmate in the state of Louisiana-- AND THAT'S THE REST OF YOUR LIFE!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: GIVE ME A NAME!

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: He's from Whiskey Bay--!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: --GIVE ME A NAME!!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Two tours in 'Nam. '69 and '71. He's a jump marine. Weapons trained, explosives.  Seven and a half out of a twelve year stint for federal robbery. Two in Angola. A year in DeQuincy. Three in El Reno with a transfer to Lewisburg. Then Marion with a brief stopover in Leavenworth. Released

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Jacket's the size of the bible.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: His stay at Marion, they kept him in "H" block.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: H block? That's home to forty top murder one inmates...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Yeah, life sentences. Jesse only had twelve years.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: He ain't just woodwork.

Speaker: dissolve to:
Dialogue: Night passes and the dawn arrives...

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Target's out.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Alright. Give him room.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: We're mobile.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: He's turnin' off.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Let's take him in the car.  Wait'll he's stopped. Watch your backgrounds.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Don't move. You motherfuck, I'll blow your head clean off.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Shut the car off slowly.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: POLICE! WARRANT!

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: GET OUT! GET THE FUCK OUT OF MY HOUSE!

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: MA'AM, CALM DOWN! CALM DOWN!

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: WE GOT A WARRANT!

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: FUCK YOU! FUCK YOU!

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Help... My baby...my baby...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: CALL AN AMBULANCE! NOW!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Toss everything.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Alright, I want everything seized!

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Motherfucker's got a general store.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: God damn...there's some weight.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'm Detective Lieutenant Bud Carter, of the East Baton Rouge Parish Precinct.  So how you like Baton Rouge?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: What happened to my wife?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Water broke. She's en route to the hospital.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: This is new.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: What's the cyanide for, Jesse?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Extracting impurities.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Impurities from what?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: You're in a bad situation here, pal.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I'll make bond.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: OUT! EVERYONE OUT! GET THE FUCK OUT!

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: What more do you want? You got a two time felon on multiple counts. You got robbery, B&E, you got an all-you-can-eat felony fuckin' possession. All on top of an organized burglary ring.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: There's more, I know it.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Remember him? Ten months ago, a judge gets popped with a .357. Well I got a Ruger from Wheeler's toilet and rushed it through ballistics.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: And?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: It's a solid match! Dead on.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: There's a dozen ways Wheeler could've got that burner. It don't prove a thing.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: A stack of bonds taken from the home of a Baptist Minister...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Murdered. He and his wife. Looked like a robbery gone to shit then; I want it opened back up.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: So who's backin' him?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I don't know; I do know they'll post his bond. That's why I need a price they can't come up with overnight.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'm right about this, Mike.  When a guy's lookin' at two hundred years and he ain't upset... It's like when your wife is accusing you of fuckin' the neighbor, but she don't know you're fuckin' her sister too. You're pretty calm about it, right?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: It's 'cause we hit the wrong nerve. The guns, the other shit, the time... He can have that conversation. And he is. And he ain't upset. He's makin' eye contact, 'cause we're fallin' short.  This guy knows things. He knows where bodies are.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: I'll bounce it up to the D.A.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: My name is Jesse Wheeler... I'm now in charge of this cell. Any y'all don't like it, step your black ass forward, line up.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Charlie... You had an inmate in '75, named Jesse Wheeler.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Charlie, you there?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: What's your interest in this guy, Bud?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Well, we got him on weapons and burglary. But I got a feelin' there's more.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Damn straight, a lot more. Race riots. Smuggling. Extorting a guard. I had a few run-ins with him myself.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: What else?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: So what the fuck happened?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Processing ain't open till morning. We threw him in holding last night. 'Fore we even turn around, it's like we're back in the fuckin' Alamo.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: He attack the guards?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Guards are fine. But he took on three niggers like they stole from him.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I'll tell you somethin', Bud. After it happened, our block was the quietest it'd ever been. Wish we had ten just like him.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Open the door.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Heard you refused a public defender.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: At the gas station...When you were arrested, I put a gun to your head. You expected someone else.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You don't look like cops.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: And your house? Guns. Mass supply tells me, intent to sell. Cyanide in the fridge, explosives...tells me you're scared.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I know who you are.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: If you knew that much, you wouldn't be in here alone.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: One more thing, pal. I saw the judge this morning.  There is no bond.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Grace? That you?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Hey there, Catfish...

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: 'The hell happened?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Oh... Excuse me.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: So where you off to?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Goin' to visit my mother. She's real sick.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: That's too bad. So you'll be gone a long time then.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Buzz.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: What can I do y'all for?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: How come the Wheeler brothers, is locked up? And you ain't?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Wheeler brothers is locked up? I don't know nothin' about that.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: I heard different.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Well there ain't no "different" to hear, Catfish. 'Cause I ain't talked to neither of 'em.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: But you did talk to someone.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: There's eyes everywhere. Like I got a sign on my back, Jesse, they all think I talked.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Just the other day... some spic fish got hit with a weight. Ten other cons, they beat him and stabbed him till there weren't nothin' left. And the guards let it happen.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: His brains were on the wall, Jesse. Like somebody painted 'em.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: They come at you?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Not yet... But it's in the mail. I can feel it fuckin' coming.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Hey, Jesse...  Sorry I put you back here. I never meant--

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: 'Cause of you, I missed the birth of my son.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Put 'em in prison, they get stronger. Everywhere you send one, they recruit in numbers. Within five years, their numbers were over ten thousand.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Wheeler directed all that, huh?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: What do you got there, Shep'?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Interpol wired us files on three known Aryan leaders in the state of Louisiana: Edgar Bingham. Harold Kay. And this man... Lucian Adams.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: High priest of the Aryan National Party. His "ministry" of Christian Identity and Paramilitary Order has stood for over a decade. Check this out...

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Wheeler was just seventeen when he met Lucian at the Patriotic Congress.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: No shit.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Today, Lucian's one hell of an entrepreneur. Owns surplus stores. Demolition. A piping business. Got trucks runnin' all across the God damn country.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Stay focused. Get back to Wheeler... I need an angle.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: For what? If Wheeler ever flipped, news would spread like wildfire. The AB's gonna know about it. They'd gonna know about it nationally.  Pass the sugar.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: That's if he was a surface informant. I don't want him to testify. I want to keep him on the street.  Look, this guy's been in it a long time. He's up to his elbows; wants to shake his hands free. I can feel it.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Braddock ain't gonna go for this.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'll handle that.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: We got one chance here. 'Cause if this falls short... Jesse Wheeler's worth more dead than alive.

Speaker: czapp
Dialogue: How you doin', Ray?  We was just over there wonderin' why you ain't got the courtesy to introduce us to your kin.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I was gonna.

Speaker: czapp
Dialogue: I'm sure you was.

Speaker: czapp
Dialogue: Jesse Wheeler. Heard of you...

Speaker: roach
Dialogue: Fuckin-A, heard a lot.

Speaker: czapp
Dialogue: Name's Czapp... You can call me, "Bossman."  I kept an eye on your brother the past few days for you. Ain't that right, Ray?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: My brother ain't none of your business.

Speaker: czapp
Dialogue: Ain't none of my business, "Bossman." And everything in this fuckin' place is my business.

Speaker: czapp
Dialogue: Listen to me, you sonofabitch. I'm gonna make one God damn thing God damn clear. Your reputation is smoke. Whatever they say you is or once was, I don't give a flyin' fuck. 'Cause it's my say-so now. And your fuckin' brother's up for grabs.

Speaker: czapp
Dialogue: Y'all got that?!

Speaker: roach
Dialogue: Fuck...

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: WHEELER!!! Stand the fuck up! Hands behind your head!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Hands behind your head! Get on the fuckin' floor!

Speaker: duty guard
Dialogue: Phone call.

Speaker: duty guard
Dialogue: It's a secure line.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I don't want my brother touched.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I'm askin' you, Lucian. My brother ain't a problem.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: You're reachin', Bud. The leverage ain't there.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: It's there. It's gotta cook a little longer, that's all.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Jesse won't so much as blink at doin' life. The fuckin' guy didn't rise in the ranks 'cause he skirts under pressure.  There's no deal to be had.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: C'mon, Mike, you know what's goin' on. Ray Wheeler compromised Jesse. By that, he compromised the Brotherhood. Don't tell me there ain't no fuckin' leverage.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: We need somethin' more.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Well we ain't sleepin' till we find it.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Life. You know how fuckin' long that is, Jesse?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: So what am I supposed to do? Wait? Run?  Your friends are comin' by the house. Askin' questions, hangin' around. Waitin' for the God damn phone to ring.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You said we were done with this. That they were out of our lives.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: We have no money, Jesse. Which means we have no fucking food. ...Say something, would you?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It's gonna be okay.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: I'm afraid. I'm afraid for my life...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: ...For our baby.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Lynn Wheeler. We haven't been properly introduced. I'm Detective Bud Carter.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: I know who you are.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: You have a ride home?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: We took the bus.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Take a cab.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: 'You need anything...anything at all. Be sure to call me.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Ray...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Raymond, take a look.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Want a cup of coffee?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: MOTHERFUCKER! This how you do things?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Yeah... When I want to talk to someone, without giving the impression he's cooperatin'.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: You got a problem.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Yeah, what's that?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: To start with, you're lookin' at two hundred years.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I've done the time. I'll do it again.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I know you can do it. But can your family?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Your brother's dead, Jesse. As we're sittin' here now, he's on a slab at St. Gabriel's Morgue. The coroner's callin' it, "suicide". You and I both know that's a load of shit.  'Less you talk...to me.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Do you hate?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Who do you hate the most? Blacks you throw in prison?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: ...I dislike what they represent in the system. Not as a whole.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: And you believe that by overthrowin' Aryan nationalism and integratin' races...polluted creeds, with us...You believe you're solvin' somethin'?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I believe we survive by integrating safety. Understanding hate, and how to stop it.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It ain't evil to fight it. It's evil to tolerate it.  Maybe you forget that, to justify what you do for a living...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Are we still in prison, or we back at the compound, havin' mass?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You don't get it.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: No, don't dictate to me what put you in here, or question my intentions with your overcooked revolution!  'Fact, I think you wanted out 'fore I even got to you! That's why you distanced yourself. That's why you're out there crackin' safes. Lookin' to live a life that ain't AB.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: In who I am, there's pressure! I work for you, I won't need a lawyer, I'll need a priest! My outside finance is gone... My wife and son, their heads wind up somewhere their bodies ain't! So tell me, why the fuck should I get involved with you?!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: How about personal warranty?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Warranty?!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Yeah, that's right! You've been a part of the problem so long, you've forgotten what the fuck that is!  "Finance..." Your wife came here on a bus to see you. I sent her home in a cab. Is that your outside fuckin' finance?!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Let me give you a little insight, pal. As to what I know... And what you think you know.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: This is today...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Is that your house? That's your wife, right? Who's this guy?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Know where he's takin' them? Takin' your family? I got a pretty good fuckin' idea.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Look at your wife, Jesse. Look at her face. And your son. They look safe to you?  I'm all you've got! I'm all your family's got! And the longer you're in here, they're up for grabs.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: So either you let that happen... Or I get the judge to allow bond. This never sees trial. And you work for me.

Speaker: judge ponder
Dialogue: You stand accused of forty counts of burglary, twenty nine counts of felony theft, possession of illegal firearms, possession or dealing in unregistered weapons, possession of a controlled substance, manufacture and possession of incendiary devices, and seventeen counts of receiving stolen goods... How do you plead?

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Not guilty, Your Honor.

Speaker: judge ponder
Dialogue: Let's hear the arguments for bail.

Speaker: district attorney
Dialogue: Your honor, this man is an habitual felon as well as a flight risk. Our office has overwhelming evidence that Mr. Wheeler is not only guilty, but also a serious threat to the community. The State recommends that bail be denied.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Your honor, my client deserves a reasonable bail. He has every intention of appearing and answering to all these false charges. In addition, he is the sole provider for his wife and newborn child, who would suffer undo hardship if this man were incarcerated.

Speaker: judge ponder
Dialogue: Bond is set at one million.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Congratulations.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: man's voice
Dialogue: How's your family?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Let's get somethin' straight. I ain't here 'cause I'm scared. I done what I did, 'cause certain people crossed the line. They didn't keep their word.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Well my word counts.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I want a body, Jesse.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: How many you want?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: 'The fuck is that?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Yard dog. Relax.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Where's this motherfucker taking us?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Dig here.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Bud! We hit something!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Clear it off! Come on, find the edges!

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: How long they been down there?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Jesse tells me six months.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Six months? Bud, they're biodegraded by now. Fuckin' worm food.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: We'll get an ID. Remember, we got the guy who put 'em there.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: 'Bout time to get a new truck there, Jesse.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Good to see you out. A free man now.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: What's goin' on, 'Fish?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: On a Sunday drive, that's all. The good Lord ridin' shotgun, through another glorious Louisiana mornin'.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Say, Jesse... Lucian's askin' about you. Fact, a lot of people are.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You tell him I'll come by.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: That's good. I'll see you real soon then.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Hey, Mike.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Bud, this is Special Agent, Martin Fitch. He's down from Washington. With the Attorney General.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Martin. Just call me Martin.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Martin's gonna be soliciting Jesse's case for a Federal sponsor.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: How long you been with the Attorney General, Fitch?

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Just over a year.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: I want to assure you my education and experience is more than adequate to handle a case of this potential.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Is that right...

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Why don't we get to the particulars?

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Right. Alright.  To get Jesse a federal sponsor, we need something substantial. A bait. In the Justice Department, we have this mission statement... We decide who the target is, what's the threat assessment, the cost value, over what time table it's gonna take place... Which target do we go after first. We don't want to miss a big target hitting a smaller target, you understand?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Well, exposing bodies has limitations. Those people are dead. We can't retrieve their lives.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: He means there might not be enough to back Jesse.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Keep him on the street without protection, he winds up dead.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: What I'm saying is, we need fresh leads. He'll need to present something that separates him from those we're going to arrest. If Jesse can't offer something continuous... I'm afraid we can't be of much help.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Ready to order?

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Yes. I'll take a garden salad. Roquefort on the side.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: You'll take what?

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: It's a dressing.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Well...we got ranch, thousand island and oil. Which one you want?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Lost my appetite.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I set this up. Me and Jesse. If the Feds want to help, that's fine. But not him.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: What do you mean, "me and Jesse?" He's not your partner, Bud. This case is beyond our capacity. It requires resources we don't have.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: They ain't takin' us serious, Mike. They send us some kid with a year under his belt?! He don't even know what state he's in... You want him in charge?!

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: You're God damn right I do! You're out on a limb on this already, Bud! It's my job to make sure you get back!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: This is bullshit.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: That may be. What it ain't, is open for discussion.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Y'all wanna talk about crime? Well I could tell y'all things. Names. Locations. What boat is movin' what drugs, which one is guns. Who's gonna get cut up and why. ...But what I got to know is, if 'n when I do this... If I wear your dog collar... Y'all gonna do what's right by me and keep my head from gettin' shot the fuck off? 'Cause the truth is, you need me. You ain't got enough cops with enough sense or enough time, to clear them crimes that already been committed and will be.  Y'all need me... I got the devil's address.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Okay, great... Thanks. Thank you, Jesse, for that. And thank you, everyone for attending...  Uh, we all know why we're here. To solve a matter of custody--

Speaker: dea
Dialogue: Those murders were drug related. DEA's got to do follow ups.

Speaker: secret service
Dialogue: He was printing counterfeit money. That's Secret Service.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: There's a hit list.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Wait! Wait a minute, quiet! Everyone quiet!

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: A hit list. There's much as twelve. Might be one or two less now, I ain't sure. Some could've already been gotten.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Now we're talkin'.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Different reasons. It ain't so much why or what they done that matters. Pick any one of 'em off that list, AB puts you on salary.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: And you, sir, if I ain't mistaken... You're Mr. Nokes, right?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: First U.S. Attorney, John Nokes?

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Well, last time I seen it...you was number two on that list.

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: Can you fill us in on the rest of those names, Jesse?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Yes, I can. But there's something I gotta make clear 'fore that happens.

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I've listened to you, Mr. Nokes. And I've listened to these suits here, on who's gonna take me in...  I want y'all to know that.

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: How's that fly by you, Lieutenant?

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: I'll sponsor him. Jesse's welfare will come out of our budget. Anyone has pending cases or leads for Jesse, see me. I'll loan him out.

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: And, Jesse... I'm a little pissed I'm number two on that list. Who the fuck is number one?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Jesse.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I'm here to see Lucian.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: He's busy right now; You can come in and wait.

Speaker: male voice
Dialogue: This operation of your's has become big business. You need relationships now more than ever...

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: ...We've done business successfully before, Mr. Adams. But it's a larger scope now. I'm here today because I want to represent you exclusively. You need someone lobbying at a state level, as well as in Washington. My organization can provide both. We've got contacts that you don't have and other people can't get. Now, I'm aware that you have multiple businesses... However you need one go-to guy, so that all your ventures stay coordinated and all transactions and contracts are realized. I am that person, Mr. Adams. That's what I do.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: What's this going to cost us?

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: As a retainer, I want an advance of three hundred-fifty thousand, along with ten percent of whatever economic benefit I bring to this organization.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Three-fifty? C'mon, Dick. That's out of line.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: If you want a quality global economic plan, that's what you pay for--

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: You've got a deal.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Give us a minute.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: You have a son now, right?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: What'd you name him?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I named him Ray.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Heard the cops smacked you around inside.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: 'Wasn't too bad.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: You've been a busy man, Jesse. More ways than one.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Looks like you done just fine without me. Business rollin' through the door.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Last I saw you, you asked for time. Time to raise a family. Time to straighten things out.  I knew right then and there, only a white respectable burglar could've done this.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Jesse... With all the work you been doin': Diamonds. Emeralds. A dozen safe jobs, behind my back...  Where's the tribute to the greater cause?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Like I said, I just needed time.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Well, even prophets stumble once in a while.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: It's a shame about your brother.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: I don't understand. Why do we have to leave the state? You're not tellin' me something. You're not tellin' me a lot.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It ain't safe here no more. You wanted out? This is out.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Lucian took the stones. Talked about jobs. High-end, boxcar.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Your family's safe now.  Let's go to work.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: There's a variety of matters to discuss today, gentlemen. Eddie Moran's trial starts next week. One of the jurors reached out. He's asking six thousand up front plus a job at four hundred a week. That guarantees a hung jury with a push for an acquittal.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Three hundred. Give him a no-show at the trucking firm.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Construction on the building Morris brought us, in south-east Florida, is complete. Every unit sold. We should see revenues of one point four million over our original projections.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Lastly, our "friends" from the Middle East. They put a final offer on the table. They'll fund our operation in Louisiana if we agree to act on their behalf. Political targets mostly, on the basis of our approval...  I advise we do a test case. Perhaps a sample of their resources.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: "Final offer?" Demands...  You believe they're travelin' all the way to Louisiana just to get fuckin' robbed?

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: I want you runnin' point on this one...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I'll be honest, I was hopin' for somethin' bigger.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: What do you got in mind?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: How 'bout a few of them heads off the list?

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: We got guys for that now. Catfish, Buzz. What do you want to go back to that for?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: The money's worth twice this. Bring back a head it's fifteen grand; Bring a heart, it's thirty, right?

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Tell you what. Do this other thing we got lined up...  Then I'll give you that taste.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: There's pressure from Washington. They send compliments for Jesse's work. But our primary concern is that list. I need names we can protect.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: We know that, Fitch. He's workin' on it.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: If Jesse can just get a direct order... from Lucian to him, on a wire--

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: --A wire?! He just went back to work, you want him to wear a fuckin' wire?  Put a tap on that God damn lawyer's phone, that's what you should do.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: He's an attorney, Carter. Anything we get would be inadmissable.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: It's information, Fitch.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Bud. We need Jesse to engage Lucian on the record. Otherwise it's just hearsay. He's disconnected from everything, like a ghost.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Catfish.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Go 'head. Count it.

Speaker: naseem
Dialogue: There a problem?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: No problem. Money's all there.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: 'The fuck you lookin' at...?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Catfish, would you shut the fuck up? This ain't the time.

Speaker: naseem
Dialogue: Yes, listen to your boss.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: What?! What fuckin' "boss?" You best watch your ass, sand nigger.

Speaker: naseem
Dialogue: Piece of shit--!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Take it easy! Take it easy!

Speaker: a voice
Dialogue: ATF! THE PERIMETER'S SURROUNDED!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You're a piece of work, Catfish.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Them niggers crossed the line...I had to burn 'em--

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: --You had to keep your mouth shut! On a job, you don't do fuckin' shit 'less I say!

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: 'The fuck off me--!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Fuck me up again, you hear me? I'll leave you where I find you. Got that?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Unload the fuckin' truck.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Keep your voice down! This was out of my control!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'm telling you, your agents best pull their shit together! Who the hell y'all trying to protect?!

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Look, Carter. This is a joint task force with multiple agendas, that run up the chain of command through me. Intel came forth at the eleventh hour that Naseem Kazuri - an international arms dealer - would be present at this meet. ATF was tasked to observe and report.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: That ain't what they did--!

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: --No! Because your informant--

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: My informant, that's right!--

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: --Your informant and his psychopath crew greased half our political interests -- over a bag of fake cash! You weren't informed, so what?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Well I better be informed! 'Cause this ain't fallin' short! Now, any of y'all got a collaborative agenda in the works? I want to see it. These other agencies, what time-lines they lookin' at? What deadlines and why?

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Above your pay-grade--

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: And is there a purposeful lack of communication between competing agencies, who are right now charting future mistakes, as we fuckin' speak?!

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: That's not your concern, Carter!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: We're not talkin' about me!!

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Bud!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: You're over-involved here.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: I'll handle this.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Thanks for coming down, Mike. He's been berating my agents for the last hour.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: We're trying to band-aid a situation here, and frankly, Carter's preference for thug tactics isn't helping. It'll all be in my report...

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: "Isn't helping?"

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: "Isn't helping?" Let's not miss what happened here, Fitch. We work for the same cause doesn't mean we work for you. What are you gonna do now? Send Jesse back out? Earn his trust? Bud Carter delivered the biggest informant in the history of this state to your lap, and you and the people you work for are gonna let it go to shit.  You can expect that will be in my report.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: Look. I had no previous knowledge of any business with Muslims. So if stealing me here in the middle of the night, is some kind of accusation--

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: I'm not accusing you, Mr. Morris. But I do find it interesting that right about the time I employ you, my operation starts having problems.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: Yes, but--

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: That is interesting...isn't it?

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: I want to know if this was an isolated incident. If the ATF impeding on my work is the result of a deeper threat.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: What are you suggesting?

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: I'm suggesting you contact your friends in Washington.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: With all due respect, Mr. Adams, that's not what I was retained for.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Well now it is.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: That sort of information requires clearance I don't have. If I start sniffing around, people are going to ask questions.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: I'm asking questions, Mr. Morris. And I'm getting impatient.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: You don't leave here till I get answers.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It's me.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I'm okay. Just need to hear your voice. How's little Ray...?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Where the hell you been?  Two days missin', you broke protocol. Three, and you're a flight risk. Agents'll hunt your ass down.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I can't keep doin' this. I can't fuckin' breathe. Even the shadows got eyes.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: This is the job. If I don't hear from you, I can't protect you.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Protect me?! I about got my head fuckin' shot off, 'cause your guys was "protecting" me!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Those ain't my guys!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I don't give a fuck-- I don't want your protection! I want out!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: There is no "out." Not for either of us. Not till it's done...  Get me that list.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'm losin' him, Mike...

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Just relax. We gotta let things settle, that's all.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: It ain't gonna settle, it's gonna blow. I can feel it.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: What do you want me to do?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Push 'em back.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: The Feds. All these suits, fuckin' outsiders. Everyone. Get me some room. Some time to reel this thing in.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: I'll talk to Nokes. 'See what I can do.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: There's an investigation underway, funded by the U.S. Attorney. And you're the target.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: They're receiving assistance from both the ATF and FBI, who are stationed right here in Henderson.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: How long they been active?

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: My sources tell me three months.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Three months...

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: This is U.S. Attorney John Nokes, at the helm. He's been after us for years.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Who they got for a mouthpiece?

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: A "mouthpiece"?

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Who's the rat in the woodpile? Who the fuck's giving 'em information?

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: I couldn't dig that deep. But it's someone close.  I suggest you gentlemen disband. Immediately.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Lucian...

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: The investigation's local point is a detective out of East Baton Rouge.  His name's Bud Carter.

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: Couldn't sleep.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Got somethin' on your mind?

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: There's been an adjustment to the list, Jesse...

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: We got this...heathen. A whore of an Irishman...down in Baton Rouge. He's protected. Got a lot of guys around him. That's why it pays. That's why nobody wants the job... That's why we're here talkin'.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Who is it?

Speaker: lucian
Dialogue: This cop... he's got a mouthpiece... somewhere. Ain't yet figured out who. In the meantime, shut him down.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It's done.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: That's his truck.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Let's see what he does.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: The fuck's takin' so long?  I would've shot that pig dead already... 'made a pulled-pork sandwich.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Give him a minute. That's a cop, lives there.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: I'll give him two.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Jesse. 'The hell you doin' here?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You been made, Bud. We gotta skin out.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Somethin's wrong...

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Relax, Catfish. You said two minutes.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Fuck you, man! This don't feel right.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Just give it a second.  A few more seconds, right guys?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Let's kill 'em both. Let's do it now, right now, let's go--

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Catfish--

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: LET'S GO!!!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Hey. Meet me at the office in ten minutes. Cobb and Marandino too.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'll explain later. Just get there. Now.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Let's hit it.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: That's them! Together, you see?!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I see 'em--

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: You see?! They're fuckin' dead!

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: What the fuck?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Fuck!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Shepard!  No...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: We run 'em now, Mike. Right fuckin' now!

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: What do you need?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No one here, Bud...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: His bleeding's under control. There's tissue damage. Projectile fragmentation in the right forearm. We have most of it removed. Two fingers are gone. A portion of the palm. There's no chance of reconstruction.  I'll be monitoring his vitals.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: You have to let go now.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: It's over.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: It's not.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: The cover's blown. Lucian's gone. There ain't nothin' left on this one.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Get to a safe-house, Bud.  'Squad car over there is your's.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: ...His cranium was smashed with a lead pipe. Then the plastic bag. He choked to death while it filled up with blood.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Got I.D.?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: 'Name's Richard Morris. He's a top dog lawyer-lobbyist out of Washington.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Put a tap on that line.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Braddock ain't gonna like it.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Bud. I just got off with Nokes.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: And?

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: We got a problem.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Give us a minute, Doc.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Where you been?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Anything else while we're out, Mrs. Wheeler?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: No thank you.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: There's a dozen cops comin' in and outta this place. No one's sayin' shit. 'The hell's goin' on?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Get me out of here, Bud. I want to see my family.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: There is no family.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'm sorry...

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: He's out of his mind. 'Asked him to slow down; and he punched me in the face.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Hey, Pete. You alright?

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: I'm alright. The bar ain't.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: We'll smooth it out. Clear the street.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Y'all fuck with me? Huh? You want to fuck with me?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Jesus Christ.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: 'Look at me when I talk to you.  You try and kill me? You like killin' women and kids?

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Easy, Bud... Easy...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We got you here, Bud... It's just us. Hear me?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Let's go home...

Speaker: police officer
Dialogue: Sign this.

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: This is an atrocity, gentlemen. Incompetence at it's highest level. I gave you my name. My resources. My trust...Carte blanche. And now this handsome face of mine...can't step foot in Washington, for fear of being laughed off the Hill.

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: Now, I'd love to point to Local on this. But truth is, they've carried their weight. We are federally fucked...  Because Federal fucked up.

Speaker: nokes
Dialogue: So. Best idea wins, gentlemen. Chain of command? Point of procedure? I don't give a fuck. That's out the window, just like our informant...  I want Jesse Wheeler found.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: You smell like a fuckin' distillery, Bud. Clean up... 'find your boy.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Get out.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: We got some shit to discuss.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Ain't got nothin' to say to you, Wheeler.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: FUCK! FUCK! OH, FUCK!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: House call.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Where's Lucian?!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I don't know!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: NO ONE KNOWS WHERE LUCIAN IS! NO ONE KNOWS-

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: ...fuck...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Who killed my family?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Ah shit, man!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: WHO KILLED 'EM?! CATFISH?!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: CATFISH, YES, YEAH! FUCKIN' CATFISH!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: WAIT, WAIT! WHAT ARE YOU DOIN'?!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: NO! NO, NO, NO, DON'T!! DON'T!!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We've had a tap on Kiersey's line forty eight hours now. It's clean. Whatever's he's up to, Bud, it ain't comin' through the front door.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Carter! We need to talk.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Get out of my way, Fitch.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: This is my investigation. Jesse's cowboy bullshit is not how it's done!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: While your agents build their cases and set for court, he'll erase the debt owed to all of you. Overnight.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: So you're implying I should thank him?

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Look, Carter, whether we like it or not, you and I have to work together on this. We entice Jesse back. I'll get him full protection, if he agrees to testify.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: That'll never happen.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Why the hell not?!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: 'Cause it's over, Fitch. It's done. He has nothing. Why do you think he lit that fire? To plant a flag. To let us know he doesn't need our protection. Doesn't want it. He would've just left 'em for dead.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: For God sakes, listen to me! I'm not taking the fall for this! The plan is--

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: No, the truth is, Fitch, you ain't got balls big enough to relate to this guy. If you had listened to me, we wouldn't be in this situation. Jesse wouldn't be in this situation. And you wouldn't be askin' stupid fuckin' questions!  I'll bring him in myself. Just keep your agents off my ass.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Get back to the office. Follow up on the Arthur Bierce case. I need names and numbers on my desk by three pm.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: OH, CHRIST! JESUS CHRIST! MY HANDS!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: You know who I am?

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: OPEN THE TRUNK! PLEASE! OPEN THE TRUNK!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: You know who the fuck I am?!

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: YES!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Who's Richard Morris?! Why was he killed?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'll break every fuckin' bone you got. Start talkin'.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: I can't-- I can't--

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Can't what?! What can't you do?!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: You piece of shit, talk!

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: He made Jesse...The investigation... Everything...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: His family?

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Everything! After that, he was just a loose end!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Where's Lucian Adams?

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: I don't know!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Lucian's goin' down. You either go down together, or you give him to me.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: I never talk to him directly! I swear, they page me--

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: --Every night at five, for a six o'clock call! They page from different numbers!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: You're a dead man, Kiersey.

Speaker: tattoo artist
Dialogue: 'Bout out of room, Catfish. You best start collectin' scalps.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: What the fuck?!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: What do you got?

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: He's in the French Quarter. All numbers paging Kiersey between five and six p.m., the last seventy-two hours, are pay phones within a three mile radius.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Alright.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Bud, you gotta talk to Braddock. He's lookin' for you, he's fuckin' pissed.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Hold him off. I'll square it with him when I get to the Quarter.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I'm gonna ask questions...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: When I'm satisfied with your answers, I'm gonna kill you. How long it takes and how much blood you want to spill...that's up to you.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: What do you want to know? Want to hear about your brother? How we had him shot up with strychnine? How he died slow death?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: OH, YOU SONOFABITCH!!!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Four days ago, my wife and son were killed.  I hear you took the contract?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Forty-four pounds, Miznay-Schardin. Like you taught me. Fuck yeah, I took it. Blew your bitch and kid sky high.

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: MOTHERFUCKER!!!

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: OH, YOU'RE GONNA DIE! YOU'RE GONNA FUCKIN' DIE!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Where's Lucian?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Where's he hidin' out?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: Get fucked.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Where's Lucian?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Where's Lucian?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: New Orleans...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: New Orleans. Where in New Orleans?

Speaker: catfish
Dialogue: New Orleans...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I believe you.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: It's Bud. I got a number.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Governor Nicholls Wharf. Between St. Ann and Toulouse. You're a half mile south.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Get your ass down here.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Here we go.

Speaker: jacket
Dialogue: Should've been on the road twenty minutes ago. Hurry it up.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: What's goin' on, Jack?

Speaker: mills
Dialogue: Talk to me.

Speaker: jacket
Dialogue: Got nothin' to tell. Kiersey didn't call.

Speaker: mills
Dialogue: Try his office?

Speaker: jacket
Dialogue: 'Ain't there. His home neither.

Speaker: mills
Dialogue: Keep pagin' him.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: C'mon. Show me somethin'.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Mr. Kiersey. I'm Captain Mike Braddock. How can I help you?

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Detective Bud Carter is out of control!

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Detective "Lieutenant." Now how can I help you?

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: How long till you make an arrest in your investigation of Lucian Adams?

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: I'm willing to provide you with documents and information to secure his conviction.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Why do you think? I'm afraid for my life.  I'll confirm whatever Jesse Wheeler's given you.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Bud, you see this?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: They're on the second floor.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: You better have something fuckin' good.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I'm in the French Quarter. Sittin' on AB activity.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Lucian?

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Don't know yet. I got Harold Kay so far.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Looks like they own the God damn block.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Well I got Kiersey just walked in. Two fractured wrists and scared as all hell.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: I can explain--

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: He wants to make a deal, Bud. I can keep Nokes in the dark twenty-four hours, but that's it.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Hold on, Mike.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Go ahead...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Holy shit.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Mike, I've got Edgar Bingham now. Just showed with two of his crew, for a sit down with Kay.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Got 'em.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Mike, I need Kiersey to place a call. Five minutes, or this opportunity's gone.

Speaker: braddock
Dialogue: Give me the number...

Speaker: mills
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: mills
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: I apologize. I've been tooth and nail with the D.A., in court, all day.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Everything's fine. Just lay low. Regular time tomorrow.

Speaker: kiersey
Dialogue: Now get me protection.

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: So?

Speaker: mills
Dialogue: All good. Let's eat.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Call went down.

Dialogue: Just lookin' for a drink and a bite to eat.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Alright. Thanks.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: We wait.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: I've got a man on the south balcony. Armed.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Second man at the door now. Street level. Possibly armed.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: A Cadillac and a Grand Marquis, just pulled in the alley.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Bud... we got Lucian Adams...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Hold position. Give me a head count.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: I need eyes on a single, white male crossing Esplanade. Possible intent...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: It's Jesse...

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Let him go.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Let him go.

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: That's exactly what we're gonna do! We got no way inside. Let Jesse go in hard and draw fire. He pushes Lucian out to us. Stand the fuck down. I'm on my way.

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: I don't see him. I got nothin'...

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Fuck!

Speaker: marandino
Dialogue: Shots fired! Shots fired!

Speaker: bud
Dialogue: Call it in! Local and SWAT! Get the place surrounded!

Dialogue: Give me that fuckin' shotgun!

Dialogue: POLICE! TAKE YOUR HANDS OFF THE GUN! STEP FUCKIN' BACK!!

Dialogue: Jam the alley! No one goes in or out!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Down! Get down!

Dialogue: I got him... I got Lucian.
